cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles SSW of Great Inagua Island
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest today, turning northwest on Friday and moving near the Florida Keys Saturday, then northward just off Florida’s west coast toward the Florida Panhandle late Sunday.

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect – only watches for parts of Haiti, Bahamas and Cuba at this time.
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect – no tropical-storm warnings issued for Florida as of this advisory.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern Bahamas, northern Cuba, Florida Keys, South & West Florida Peninsula including Tampa Bay area, and the northern Gulf Coast from the Florida Panhandle westward to Alabama.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force wind gusts (35–45 mph) possible late Saturday night through Sunday morning as Fred’s center passes just offshore to the west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None specifically forecast for Tampa Bay/Port Manatee at this time; minor coastal flooding cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated totals up to 8 inches possible beginning late Friday night through Sunday, producing localized flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Gulf beaches; brief squalls could reduce visibility for vessel traffic.
